section.title: Emphasis
section.sectiontitle: Passive constructions can be used to emphasise information at the beginning of a sentence.
section.text2: Someone threw an egg which hit the Prime Minister.
section.text2a: The Prime Minister was hit with an egg.
section.sectiontitle2: Fronting: You can change the order of clauses in a sentence to put a clause at the beginning which would not normally be there.
section.text3a: What she thinks she is doing, I don't know!
section.text4a: How we will manage is a mystery.

section.title: Emphasis
section.sectiontitle: Cleft sentences. Sentences introduced with It is/It was, or by a clause beginning with what can be used to emphasise different parts of the sentence.
section.text1a: It was me who spotted the mistake.
section.text2a: What we need to do is focus on the positive.
section.sectiontitle2: Adding words for emphasis: own, indeed, in the least bit, at all, even, utterly, sheer, wherever, do.
section.text3a: They aren't in the least bit scared.
section.text4a: It was utterly pointless us being there.
